fields.summary: Improve consistency of spacing of lists and paragraphs

fields.description:
[This is a link to Confluence| http://confluence.atlassian.com | This is the mouse over text]

In the "Info" tab, the "This is the mouse over text" is incorrectly designated as an outgoing link
fields.summary: Outgoing Link Bug for MouseOver Text

fields.description:
This is easiest to describe with an example.  Let's say I have this setup...

{blog-posts:5|labels=qa,meeting,minutes|match-labels=all}

According to the help text the "5" represents the number of news items to display.

>> If one of the LAST 5 news items entered does not contain all of these labels nothing appears.  In this case the last 5 news items with "qa", "meeting", and "minutes" should appear.  The macro appears to be counting news items that do not meet this criteria when selecting what to display.

As a workaround I set the number to 50.
fields.summary: Blog-posts macro limits number of results before applying label filter rather than after

fields.description:
Replication steps:

In WYSIWYG mode:
* Create a bullet point "bullet"
* Create a second bullet "bullet 2"
* Now change the second bullet to a numbered bullet by clicking the icon
* Switch to wiki notation

Notaton I get is this:

* Bullet 
* *# Bullet 2

Should be

* Bullet
*# Bullet 2
fields.summary: Mixing ordered and unordered lists confuses WYSIWYG at times
Search results should treat search terms and "stop words" differently

fields.description: HTML export fails to include .zip files attached although it does include the images. It also fails to convert the href for the icons used for messages boxes (i.e. {note}, {info}, etc), The generated HTML points to /images on the root directory instead of the relative /icons directory.
fields.summary: HTML export fails to include all attachments

fields.description: It would be very handy in support requests if we included the database driver name and version in the "System Info" and error page output.
fields.summary: Include Database driver information on the "System Info" and error pages
Allow option of hiding default header for favourite pages Macro

fields.description:
This was thrown around for a bit, but an issue was never created.

It doesn't make sense for a normal user to have less permissions than the anonymous user, so they should inherit those permissions.

e.g. anonymous user has access to space XYZ, but a logged in user does not.

The logged in user should have access to space XYZ, because they could access it when logged out anyway.
fields.summary: Confluence users should inherit permissions from the anonymous user
Include favourite pages macro in the notation guide

fields.description: When I give anonymous access to a space it works for anonymous users.  When I log into Confluence, I can no longer see the anonymous spaces.  It would be nice if logged in users could perform the same actions as anonymous users.
fields.summary: Giving Anonymous Access does not give logged in user permission

fields.description:
Linking Macros
Vendor: randombits.org
Plugin Version: 1.4.7
plugins-linking-1.4.jar
+
Utilities Plugin
Vendor: randombits.org
Plugin Version: 1.4.4
plugins-utilities-1.4.jar

installed.

{add-page:template=template XYZ|parent=page ABC} Click here to add a new page {add-page} 

On klicking the Link a new page openes with the template content but without any parent page filled in. The same when using @parent. In Version 1.4.1 this macro worked fine.
fields.summary: add-page macros parent page definition fails
Return plain text attachments as text/plain
Problem when rendering complex table-content

fields.description: Search doesn't notify user about search words that were stop filtered, so sometimes it looks like the search doesn't work
fields.summary: Search doesn't notify user about search words that were stop filtered

fields.description:
Content change flag in editor is not corect, so this condition doesn't work in decorators/effects.js:
	if (original == newContent)
as some newline is prepanded to newContent always.
Tested when wiki editor is set to open by default in global settings this may be difference as couldn't reproduce on your demo site. 
But changing the above to:
	if (original == newContent.trim())
works fixes the bug.
Don't think surrounding spaces will ever matter in this case so trimming them.
fields.summary: Unsaved changes in the rich text editor should disregard whitespace

fields.description:
Clicking '+' next to Home to display the tree view of a space creates error:

HTTP Status 404 - /pages/children.action
type Status report
message /pages/children.action
description The requested resource (/pages/children.action) is not available.

There are no errors in catalina.out relating to this issue.
fields.summary: Space tree view causes http status 404 error

Make expiry time for drafts configurable
Make it easier for users to find their drafts

fields.description:
If the Anonymous use doesn't have global USE permission, showing space-level anonymous permissions is confusing.

If there is no global USE_CONFLUENCE permission for anonymous users, the space perms page shouldn't show the anon section, and should instead say something like:

"Anonymous access must be enabled globally before you can allow anonymous access to a space."

If the user is a global admin, provide a direct link to the global perms page.
fields.summary: Don't show space-level anonymous permissions if global use permission not set

fields.description:
If you perform the steps to set the parent page of a page as itself, the following exception occurs:

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Can not set page as its own parent.
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page.checkParentValid(Page.java:75)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page.setParentPage(Page.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page.addChild(Page.java:125)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.EditPageAction.updateParentPage(EditPageAction.java:240)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.EditPageAction.doSaveEditPageBean(EditPageAction.java:183)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.EditPageAction.doEdit(EditPageAction.java:221)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)

Steps to reproduce (borrowed from CONF-4940):

1. start with an existing page
2. bring up the page update screen
3. enter the name of the page in the page's parent page field
4. save ('update')
5. EXPECT: validation error indicating that a page cannot be its own parent
6. reenter the name of the page in the parent page field, but this time with a different case
7. EXPECT: validation error indicating that a page cannot be its own parent
fields.summary: IllegalArgumentException when setting page as its own parent page

fields.description:
I have had a user report a problem with a page he updated. After investigation, I suspect he fell victim to the following bug, which I was able to reproduce in a test space.

Here is the scenario and the expected behavior:
1. start with an existing page
2. bring up the page update screen
3. enter the name of the page in the page's parent page field
4. save ('update')
5. EXPECT: validation error indicating that a page cannot be its own parent
6. reenter the name of the page in the parent page field, but this time with a different case
7. EXPECT: validation error indicating that a page cannot be its own parent

In reality however, while expectation 5 is met (" The page itself can not be set as its own parent page."), expectation 7 fails and the page is saved.
Because page name uniqueness in Confluence is on a case-insensitive basis (even though the case is preserved), the resulting page is in effect pointing to itself as its own parent. Unsurprisingly trying to access the page causes the system error below (stack overflow due to infinite recursion in the Page.getAncestry() method).

Beside needing the defect to be fixed (to avoid future page corruption), I also need help restoring the affected user pages to a working order. Or will I have to ask them to recreate the pages by hand?

 Cause:
org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getAncestry' in class com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page threw exception class java.lang.StackOverflowError : null

fields.summary: Page can be set as its own parent page, resulting in data corruption

fields.description: Page deletions should show up along with page creations and modifications.
fields.summary: Send notifications when deleting content (e.g. when moving it to the trash) instead of sending them when purging the trash

fields.description:
After upgrading confluence from 2.0 to 2.0.3 all names of mail attachments are wrong (see attached screenshot from single mail view -- the correct name would be "btn_cancel_over.gif").
This issue combined with the seemingly ever delayed CONF-4527 renders the mail archive functionality to a very disappointing feature i wish i had not activated at all, because we are in a "hey, here is the new beautiful intranet"-stage to convince the skeptical people and ever since upgrading to Version 2 on every Space-Homepage we have an recently updated pages macro that not only does not work but now also gets more worse. :(
fields.summary: Names of mail attachments are wrong
Make list of children hierarchical
Current paragraph edit/preview

fields.description:
Preview is not working when richeditor is disabled in global options. This seems was working at least in 2.0.1.
I'm disabled wysiwyg editor to improve performance but this leaded to the issue above. 
Will it actually improve simple editor page loading when rich editor disabled?
fields.summary: Preview is not working when richeditor is disabled.

fields.description:
Sorry I don't have time to search through your bug repository for duplicates.

Steps:

Added an image using the attachments tab
Go to edit existing page (rich text editor as default)
Got to bottom of page content
Use the icon to add an image
Choose the image I attached previously, align left
Click OK to close the image dialog
Click Save to save the edit

Results:
java.lang.RuntimeException: JTidy rejected the rendered xhtml:
fields.summary: Save error on Rich Text Editor with Image

fields.description: The bug manifests itself when multiple users with the same name are retrieved from the user table.
fields.summary: JiraJdbcProfileProvider incorrectly accesses user profile information.

fields.description:
Image tags for the following types stopped working once we upgraded to Confluence 2.0.1

!filename.bmp! <- bmp is not a valid image type anymore
!http://some.url.com/file! <- the External URL doesn't have a file extension and Confluence used to place the URL into the Image tag and it would render...now it gets handled as an unknown type.

Both types of link were in use inside our 1.4.2 deployment
fields.summary: Image Linking Broken

fields.description:
We need to update our use of seraph to delegate the definition of the logout url to seraph-config.xml

h2. Workaround for Confluence 5.7.2 and older
# Find and copy <confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-x.x.x.jar to a temp location (with "x.x.x" representing your Confluence version number)
# Extract the file: {{jar -xf confluence-x.x.x.jar}}
# Open {{xwork.xml}} in an editor and locate this section:
{code}
<action name="logout" class="com.atlassian.confluence.user.actions.LogoutAction">
            <interceptor-ref name="defaultStack"/>
            <result name="error" type="velocity">/logout.vm</result>
            <result name="success" type="redirect">/login.action?logout=true</result>
        </action>
{code}
# Replace the redirect URL for {{success}} result to the desired URL, e.g.:
{code}
            <result name="success" type="redirect">/my_custom_url.html</result>
{code}
# Save the file, and copy it to <confluence_install>/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/
# Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Confluence is not using the seraph logout url to define how to log out.

fields.description:
If you create a page with dangling links to images, save it and then edit it as wiki markup then the link is lost.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new page with the following content:

!myimagefile.png|align=centre!

2. Save the page.
3. Edit the page, note in the default "Rich Text" tab the link is present and hilighted red because the file doesn't exist.
4. Change to the "Wiki Markup" tab. No link.
fields.summary: Unresolved Image Links are replaced in WYSIWYG mode

fields.description:
It would be useful if Confluence autosaved Pages every X (configurable) seconds when editing a Page. It could be stored as a "temporary" page without creating a new version (should be stored per user). Then each user should be able to restore an "autosaved" version that was not actually saved by pressing a button.

This is because we can lose our work if something happends to windows / internet explorer / mozilla or even if some program triggers a page load on the same window we are editing the page. All of these happened to me :)

An example of this behaviour is GMAIL's autosave.
fields.summary: Autosave when editing Pages
Option to prevent page events from appearing on the recently updated list

fields.description: Browser Search (Ctrl+F) in Wiki Editor is absent starting v2.x.
fields.summary: Browser search in the wiki markup editor does not work

fields.description:
The following wiki url with anchor is not rendered in 2.x
[more|http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-5.5-doc/manager-howto.html#Configuring Manager Application Access|Manager App HOW-TO]
fields.summary: Links to anchors with spaces in the name do not render correctly

fields.description: Plugin jar is missing from page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/Agile+Velocity+Tracking+plugin
fields.summary: Agile plugin jar missing

fields.description: The multi threaded indexing process should be able to run (if somewhat slowly) with fewer database connections that with threads, WITHOUT locking up Confluence. In practice, this does not appear to be the case. We need to investigate. See  CSP-1450 for details.
fields.summary: Investigate database connection leak in indexing.

fields.description: When a bitmap file is attached and embedded in a page, the embedded resource renderer doesn't recognise the MIME type. This is because we don't have a definition for bitmaps in the mime.types file.
fields.summary: Windows bitmap files not recognised by the embedded resource renderer

fields.description: There is currently no default mapping for sub-task icons in the Jira issues macro.
fields.summary: Jiraissues does not have an icon mapping for subtasks
Color tags surrounding a link are not rendered correctly by WYSIWYG

fields.description:
The following markup is not converted correctly to XHTML (and thus not back again, either):

\[\{color:blue\}Foo\{color\}|Bar\]

(Ignore the escapes)

It seems that since the inner color tags are interpreted first, the tokenised version of it is set as the originalLinkText, and when the link is rendered, font markup appears inside the attributes of the "a" tags. Probably needs quite a bit of fudging around to fix it.

The above test case is commented out in TestSimpleMarkup in the renderer project.
fields.summary: Color tags inside a link are not rendered correctly in the Rich Text Editor

fields.description: So, I've got a page, that contains {children:excerpt=true}.  One of the pages has an {except}, and the text shows up on the parent page just fine.  But when the {excerpt} macro is removed, then parent page still shows that excerpt text.  I have to save with an empty {except}{except} to fix the problem.
fields.summary: excerpt in page, still shows in children even after the except macro was removed

fields.description: This seems to be occurring on the membership check. For now we have put in a workaround, we reload the group before checking its membership values.
fields.summary: HibernateGroupManager runs into a closed session when running with ldap + hibernate + caching configuration

fields.description: Try editing http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Flowchart+Macro
fields.summary: {excerpt} macro in table breaks in WYSIWYG

fields.description:
I have the following link  on a page:  [`steve.altus@somecompany.com]
When I try to replace the ` with a ~ in the WYSIWYG editor it appears as changed under the Rich Text tab, but if a Save or even Preview that page it still shows the  original text.  I have to go into the Wiki Markup tab to successfully change that particular text.  Other text changes work fine.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG editor not accepting certain edits on Save

fields.description:
This was working fine as late as Confluence 1.4.1.  When we updated to Confluence 2.0.2 we had several external links break.  It appears the culprit is the ' in the filename.  Here's an example:

* [Customer Service FAQ|http://someserver:8080/pls/portal/docs/PAGE/GENERAL_AVIATION_SALES_AND_SERVICES/TRAINING_DOCUMENTS/CFI_RENEWAL/CFI%20RENEWAL%20FAQ'S.DOC]

This I'd prefer not see people using filenames like this, but I'm disappointed to see something that was working fine fail in the new version of Confluence.
fields.summary: External links containing ' no longer work in Confluence 2.0.2

fields.description: See attached screenshot
fields.summary: Profile changes appear multiple times in Recently Changed List

fields.description:
1. Scrolling down on any page
2. clicking on a link
3. using the "Back" button in the Firefox browser

=> starting at the top of the article again

Using IE I didn´t experience this behavior.  Is this a browser problem within Mozilla / Firefox? Or do the two following lines in the header of Confluence sites affect this behavior which probably can be changed with a configurable caching option?

<META HTTP-EQUIV="Pragma" CONTENT="no-cache">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Expires" CONTENT="-1"> 

Background: 90 percent of our staff (and some customers) use Mozilla / Firefox and we want to establish program documentations in Confluence (will be a few thousand docs at least) that are linked among each other. Getting back after clicking to another documentation will let the Confluence user start at the top again and not at the point he read a few moments ago.

Thanks for an answer.
fields.summary: Browser back button in Firefox 1.0/1.5 leads to the top of the previous article (expected: point of the page where the user read before)
Add parameter to include an edit link for included pages

fields.description:
I believe there is currently no Wiki Markup support for indenting text in Confluence. 

However, the Rich Text editor has buttons which make it look like Confluence supports this feature. When pressing the button, the text appears as if the quote macro was used. But when changing to markup and back, the indenting is gone.
fields.summary: Rich text editor indenting feature does not seem to work

fields.description:
Occassionally there are problems recognising the MIME type of a file, so we should allow the user to specify the "type" property, which will override the discovered type in the EmbeddedResourceParser.

e.g. \!http://traffic.alexa.com/graph?w=379&h=216&r=6m&y=r&u=google.com/&u=yahoo.com\|type=image/jpg\! will render the file as an image, even though there is no file extension in the URL.
fields.summary: Allow syntax to override the file MIME type in embedded objects
Add scrolling ability to noformat macro

fields.description:
Plugin keys in mixed-case are not found when you try to use them in the page, though they show up properly in the admin interface. See this thread:

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?forumID=101&threadID=9335
fields.summary: Plugin keys must be lowercase

fields.description:
I am currently in the process of evaluating Confluence as an appropriate solution to start a wiki for our enterprise. I am trying to convert several of our documents over into the wiki markup format. One of the most difficult things to do is indent a sentence. This would be accomplished by using a tab in Word. The only way I can see doing this in your wiki markup is by embedding several nbsp; Columns, tables and lists are not a valid replacement. For example, I want to show a directory structure. To adequately do that, I need to do something like the following:

   \Product Name
      \Project Name
         Project Name.sln (VS.NET solution file)
         Project Name.build (Nant build file)
         \doc

While this accomplishes the task, it is tedious to enter and hard to maintain. Many wiki's support " : " to indent. " :: " to do a double indent.
fields.summary: Wiki markup should support easily indenting a line

fields.description:
If a user supplies a wrong password and LDAP, Confluence tries its local userdb too. According to CONF-2854 this was fixed, so apparently I'm doing something wrong. I tried to set empty passwords in the local db, but Confluence won't accept that.

I get 2 errors at startup, maybe that's got to do something with it?
fields.summary: How to disable fallback to local auth if LDAP auth fails?

fields.description: Pages containing a filename such as "test.txt" can only be found by searching for "test.txt", but not by searching for "tes*".
fields.summary: Support substring searches for attachment file names

fields.description:
When granting anonymous users space access without granting them use-confluence access in global permissions, confluence should warn you that anonymous users will still be unable to access the content. Without a warning, it is all too easy to get confused over why I have granted anonymous access, and yet users are still asked to login.

A warning on the space permissions page when this occurs would resolve this - such as "You have set permissions for anonymous access on this space. You will need to grant anonymous the use-confluence global permission."
fields.summary: Warn users when granting anonymous users space access without granting then user-confluence access

fields.description:
Problem: 
When using JIRAPORTLET and JIRAISSUES macros in Confluence whith both JIRA and Confluence being secured with HTTPS (using client certificates) the problem is that these portlets are not working ( a known problem) . A workaround would be (at least when both JIRA and Confluence are installed on the same machine) to configure the Apache for localhost calls to work without the client certificates (without SSL).
Therefore the JIRAPORTLET can be used with an adapted URL parameter using http://localhost/..
BUT the problem now is that all links in the displayed portlet are generated with this 'wrong' localhost domain! 

Solution:
The portlet generates all links with the base URL set in the general configuration of the called JIRA instance!

Currently this is a real crtical issue in our customer project that this is not working!
fields.summary: Using JIRA base-URL for JIRAPORTLET and JIRAISSUES links

fields.description:
Example:

Adding the WIKI markup below

|| Priority || Item || Status ||
| {color:red}*10*{color} |h4. |

then switching to the WYSIWYG and back again turns the wiki context into 

|| Priority || Item || Status ||
| {color:red}*10*{color} |
h4.
|
fields.summary: Table containing heading is broken by WYSIWYG editor.

fields.description: The backup restore UI is hanging, not showing the progress of the restore. This is rather misleading.
fields.summary: Backup restore progress monitor does not refresh during restore, making it look like the backup is hanging.

fields.description:
EG:

[Confluence 2.0 Home (Space Home Page)]  Confluence 2.0 Home  (Confluence 2.0 User Guide)
Labels: userguide, documentation, ~jens@atlassian.com:favourite, ~name:favourite

This is not good.
fields.summary: Personal labels showing up on the {contentbylabel} macro.

fields.description: It is cleaner to not show the whole option if the user does not have permission to add content.
fields.summary: Hide "Add Content" Links in Left Navigation Theme if user does not have permissions to add any kind of content.

fields.description: It seems that Google News RSS is forbidden to requests which don't specify a user agent (cf. http://slashdot.org/comments.pl?sid=158575&threshold=1&commentsort=0&tid=217&tid=149&tid=1&mode=thread&pid=13285426#13286792). It would be good if the {rss} macro could add a user agent to the request to enable Google News RSS access.
fields.summary: Google News RSS requires a user agent for access

fields.description: I'm using {contentbylabel:r3-2,requirement} to get a list of requirements specifications for our 3.2 release. Since I also have a lot of 3.1 requirements the are labeled "r3-1, requirement" that also get returned. And also the result is combined, so first I get a list of all document matching r3-2 and then a list matching requirements and several document will then appear twice in the list.
fields.summary: Remove duplicate results from the {contentbylabel} macro.
"Insert Table Wizard" should allow first column as header column

fields.description: If you put in the text \?\?Home\?\? (without escapes, if they appear here) in wiki markup mode, then switch to rich text and back again, the citation markup is lost.
fields.summary: "Citation" markup is not converted between Rich Text and Markup modes

fields.description:
Confluence 2.0.1, Oracle 8.1.7, when trying to delete space from Space Admin, getting error report:

Cause:
org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: Bad SQL grammar [] in task 'Hibernate operation'; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00933: SQL command not properly ended

Stack Trace: [hide]

org.springframework.jdbc.BadSqlGrammarException: Bad SQL grammar [] in task 'Hibernate operation'; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00933: SQL command not properly ended

java.sql.SQLException: ORA-00933: SQL command not properly ended

at oracle.jdbc.driver.DatabaseError.throwSqlException(DatabaseError.java:125)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:305)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CTTIoer.processError(T4CTTIoer.java:272)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4C8Oall.receive(T4C8Oall.java:626)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.doOall8(T4CPreparedStatement.java:182)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.execute_for_describe(T4CPreparedStatement.java:500)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.execute_maybe_describe(OracleStatement.java:942)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.T4CPreparedStatement.execute_maybe_describe(T4CPreparedStatement.java:532)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleStatement.doExecuteWithTimeout(OracleStatement.java:1037)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeInternal(OraclePreparedStatement.java:2905)
at oracle.jdbc.driver.OraclePreparedStatement.executeQuery(OraclePreparedStatement.java:2946)
at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:205)
at net.sf.hibernate.impl.BatcherImpl.getResultSet(BatcherImpl.java:87)
at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.getResultSet(Loader.java:875)
at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQuery(Loader.java:269)
at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doQueryAndInitializeNonLazyCollections(Loader.java:133)
at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.doList(Loader.java:1033)
at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.list(Loader.java:1024)
fields.summary: Deleting space fails on Oracle 8i with SQLException

fields.description: After making a change to a news item a "view changes" link appears at the top of the page. Clicking on this link produces an error ("Could not find the specified page versions").
fields.summary: Link for viewing changes displayed in news pages

fields.description:
You are currently using terms such as page, news, and labels to describe the sections of  the Confluence software.  The terminology fits but is not what is most widely accepted on the internet. It would be nice if there were variables for all of these terms that could be changed in one configuartion file.  That way a user could use wiki, blog, and tags if they prefer. (Or favorites and colors :) )

It would only require the change of the velocity pages but would add a lot of flexibility and allow for easier theme creation and maintenence.
fields.summary: Variables to change terminology on Velocity Pages
Allow emoticons to be enabled or disabled via the administrative interface
Separate "face" emoticons from other emoticons

fields.description:
When editing a page, EDIT links such as Location, Restrictions, and Labels do not function when using FireFox Web browser.

FireFox JavaScript Console states:
Error: toggleVisibility is not defined
Source File: http://localhost/confluence/pages/editpage.action?pageId=555  Line 945
fields.summary: JS Functions using toggleVisibility do not work with Firefox
Include breadcrumbs in email notifications

fields.description:
Error message when starting Tomcat: 

2005-12-08 07:51:01,864 FATAL [user.providers.jira.JiraJdbcProfileProvider] Could not see if [administrator] is handled

with the following important stack trace line: at com.atlassian.confluence.user.providers.jira.JiraJdbcProfileProvider.getJiraPropertySet(JiraJdbcProfileProvider.java:161)

which is the following statement:
ps = conn.prepareStatement("SELECT " + membershipIdCol + " FROM "+ membershipTable +" WHERE user_name = " + username);

=> in my opinion, the problem is the missing >>'<< around username which results in an SQL statement >>... WHERE user_name = administrator<< instead of   >>... WHERE user_name = 'administrator'<<

Could you please check?
fields.summary: Wrong SQL-Statement in JiraJdbcProfileProvider?

fields.description: Instead, it should die gracefully and report that there are no labels.
fields.summary: Navigation map macro throws NullPointerException when there are no labels

fields.description: Currently the children listing on the bottom of the page orders the child pages based on the creation date - it would be nice if the order of the listing can be sorted alphabetically -> maybe use the {children} macro to render this instead.
fields.summary: the children listing on the bottom of the page should sort the child pages alphabetically

fields.description: If you try and access a space with a key that doesn't exist, instead of being redirected to a "doesn't exist" error page, the normal space page is displayed. This needs to be fixed.
fields.summary: Accessing a space that doesn't exist by a direct URL does not result in an error page

fields.description:
Right now the old page name searching only works if the URL is ONLY the page name.

ie this doesn't find the old page:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/textFilter?focusedCommentId=146061#comment-146061

but this works fine:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/textFilter

It seems that anything after the URL causes it to break, ie:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFEXT/textFilter?

Quite probably it's not using the right part of the request.
fields.summary: Old page name scanning doesn't cut up URL correctly

fields.description: While editing content using rich text editor, clicking on insert image icon pops up a dialog. Adding a new image and clicking Attach causes a page to show in the popup that displays message resource labels instead of their real values. (ex: for ok and cancel buttons, you see ${lang_conf_ok} and ${lang_conf_cancel}.
fields.summary: Image popup shows ${lang_conf_ok} and ${lang_conf_cancel} after you have attached an image.

fields.description: I want a page to be able to show all the pages that link to it. I only want to display incoming links from within my own space while others may want to show all incoming links.
fields.summary: Macro to insert incoming links into a page

fields.description:
I wasn't aware of the trackback feature introduced in CONF-559. As a consequence our private! Confluence suddenly appeared on a blog-site.

As Confluence is an Enterprise Wiki, which often will contain security relevant information trackback should not be enabled by default.

I think it might also be useful that trackback does not send page-contents, when there is no anonymous access to that page.
fields.summary: Disable Trackback by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-4867].
  {panel}

Hi,

I'm currently using Jetspeed and spring-portlet. I use a model layer which is handled by Spring and Hibernate : Services, DAOs and BOs. Services can open hibernate sessions to perform database requests. Portlet controllers call services to get the informations back. Everything works great except when I have to get a nested BO inside a BO in a controller.
For example :
IMyService myService = (IMyService) getService ("MyServiceName");
IMyBO myBO = myService.getMyBO(someParameters);
// At this point myBO is correctly instanciated and all fileds can be accessed.
IMyOtherBO myOtherBO = myBO.getMyOtherBO();
String info = myOtherBO.toString(); // Or .getAField()
//throws a LazyInitializationException : could not initialize proxy - the owning Session was closed;

So, I tried to configure my PortletModeParameterHandlerMapping with an OpenSessionInViewInterceptor to give myBO a session back.
In my xml conf file (like books.xml) :
<bean name="openSessionInViewInterceptor" class="org.springframework.web.portlet.support.hibernate3.OpenSessionInViewInterceptor">
<property name="sessionFactory"><ref bean="hibernateSessionFactory"/></property>
</bean>

<bean id="portletModeParameterHandlerMapping" class="org.springframework.web.portlet.handler.PortletModeParameterHandlerMapping">
<property name="interceptors">
<list>
<ref bean="parameterMappingInterceptor"/>
<ref bean="openSessionInViewInterceptor"/>
</list>
</property>
<property name="portletModeParameterMap">
<map>
<entry key="view">
<map> ... All my entries views ...
</map>
</entry>
</map>
</property>
</bean>

A session is correctly initialized before the render or action call and is correctly closed after.
The problem is that the CGLIBLazyInitializer proxy object of myBO doesn't use this session but still persists using the closed session.
How can I  force it to use the good session ?
Is there another solution to my problem ?

Thanks in advance,
Romain
fields.summary: OpenSessionInViewInterceptor

fields.description:
We need to report an error when the attachment file upload files. Just failing quietly is not very helpful to the user.

The error message should be useful and hint at the fact that they may still have the file open and that is why the file upload failed.
fields.summary: Attachment upload fails with no error message when file is 'open' (locked) by another process

fields.description:
The rich text editor eats newlines in-between the horizontal rule tag and centered images.

To reproduce:

Create a new page and attach an image. Then edit the page in "WIKI Markup" mode and enter the following markup

----
!image.jpg|align=center!

Save the page. Edit it again, this time in "Rich Mode". Save the page without changing it.

If you edit the page again, you'll find that the markup is now

----!image.jpg|align=center!

which causes the horizontal rule to render incorrectly. If you rich-text edit it again you end up with

\---\-!dune.jpg|align=center!

Curiously, if you remove the 'align=center' from the image link the problem doesn't occur.


PS: Please consider this my entry for the 'least urgent issue of the month' award :)
fields.summary: Rich Text editor can mangle horizontal rule tag ('----')
Add "submit to support" button on error pages
Include user management configuration information in "error page" output
Use a page's content ID as the filename when exporting as HTML

fields.description: There are a number of issues writing any files to disk that have unicode or high-bit characters in the filename (e.g. page title for exporting to HTML, attachment filename for the Confluence home directory). We should consider whether we can use the content ID instead, which will work around this issue.
fields.summary: Review the writing/export of files to disk using content IDs, instead of filenames

fields.description: When writing attachments to disk in a backup, we should use the attachment's content ID as the folder name, instead of the filename, to avoid issues with writing unicode/high-bit characters to disk on a multitude of file systems (which may or may not support the characterset).
fields.summary: Use an attachment's content ID instead of filename when writing to disk

fields.description:
I created a page in version 1.4.4, using Wiki markup to create a table with three columns. It looks good. We upgraded to version 2.0.1. I opened the page for editing, BUT DID NOT EDIT ANYTHING. Two things went wrong:

1) When I return to View mode without saving or canceling the Edit session, I get a dialog warning me about unsaved changes, even though I didn't make any edits.

2) When I view the page in Preview mode, the table structure is messed up. Some of the pipe characters, "|", I used for laying out the table originally now display as literal characters on the screen. See attachment for screen shots of the original page and how it looks in Preview mode under the new version of Confluence.

Again, I do not have to make any edits to see both effects. It is repeatable.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Broken page table structure in Edit mode after upgrade from 1.4.4 to 2.0.1
Delete duplicated LDAP users

fields.description:
Now with LDAP integration we will suddenly have a lot of users accounts introduced to confluence.

We need to provide a way for these accounts to be added to a specified group, such as confluence-users .
fields.summary: Seraph filter / Login filter - addMembership for LDAP user to confluence-users (configurable group)

fields.description: The popup window for images can not be resized in IE, however, it can be resized in Firefox.
fields.summary: Popup window from {gallery} / {gallery-slideshow} is not resizable in IE.

fields.description:
In my 1.4.4 installation, notification emails about updated pages were queued in mail queue for days without being sent.  When I flush the queue, every mail was sent correctly except for one, which was not put into error queue (but a notification mail was sent to administrator that one email failed to reach receipient - wrong email address).

In my 2.0 installation, notification emails were not even sent or queued.  When I send test email, confluence reports that the mail was sent successfully, but no email was actually sent and no error message anywhere was found.

Having a reliable notification system that sends emails in a timely fashion is absolutely critical to us.  I have not had a chance to test 2.0.1 or 2.0.2 but they did not deal with any mail issue.  The old mail queue issues I found by searching confluence JIRA were all fixed and closed, but this mail queue problem persist somehow.
fields.summary: Notification mail queued over a week (1.4.4) or not sent (2.0)

fields.description:
Pages with long titles, around 60 characters or so, do not appear in the "Recently Updated" lists. Instead, where the page title should appear, you get something like:

$webwork.htmlEncode($textUtils.trimToEndingChar($page.realTitle, 60))... 

Editing the page title to a shorter value resolves the problem.
fields.summary: Long page titles cause bad display error in "Recently Updated" lists

fields.description:
If you logon to both system with same browser (without select "Remember my login on this computer"), session breaks.

How to reproduce:

01. Start Firefox
02. Open new tab in Firefox
03. Logon to JIRA without clicking "Remember my login on this computer"
04. Open any issue
05.  Open new tab in Firefox
06. Logon to Confluence without clicking " Open new tab in Firefox"
07. Open any space
08. Switch back to JIRA tab and try to open another issue or comment

Result 1: your are logged off - JIRA needs logon
Result 2: switch to Confluence, and Confluence needs logon
fields.summary: Session breaks if JIRA 3.4.1 and Confluence 2.0.1 on same machine

fields.description:
Attachment filename:
- hinzufügen.JPG
- löschen.png

2005-12-02 12:16:08,056 ERROR [atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultAttachmentManager] Error removing the attachments folder for the page with id: 1686 folder: /opt/data/weblogic/confluence/attachments/1686/hinzuf?gen.JPG Not writable

2005-12-02 14:59:03,544 ERROR [confluence.importexport.impl.PdfExporter] Error while copying the pag
e attachments!
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /opt/data/weblogic/confluence/attachments/315/l?schen.png/1 (No such file or directory)
fields.summary: German Umlaut in attachment filenames causes exception
